. British Airways, BWIA, American Eagle, Monarch, Air Canada, Virgin Atlantic, Caribbean Star, Liat, Air Jamaica, Conviasa (Venezuela), Condor (Germany) and Excel Airways provide direct service to Grenada; connections can be made on other carriers via Trinidad and Barbados.
. A brand new cruise ship terminal was recently completed, allowing up to 5 ships to be docked at once. Private moorings are available all around the island.

content=Ferry service between the islands of Grenada,
From Carriacou for Grenada (1hr 15mins) M-Sa at 6AM and 3:30PM; Su at 3:30PM.
From Grenada to Carriacou (1hr. 15mins) M-F 9AM and 5:30PM; Sa at 9AM; Su 8AM and 5:30PM.

in Grenada are the standardized form of transportation. These vans hold between 15-19 people, and they have route numbers and signs on them. Weekdays they run from 7AM-7PM. In town, there are designated bus stops, however, once you leave town, you can signal a stop by either knocking on the wall or pressing the stop button. Conductors and drivers are always very friendly, so do not hesitate to ask them where you should stop. Bus fares vary between EC$2.00-8.00 depending on the distance. They are lively trips, with great music and a nice breeze.

Many

companies are available, with rates (about $50/day - 2007) comparable to those in the US.  With a valid license from your home country you will qualify for a temporary Grenada license for a small fee ($12 in 2007) which the rental company will take care of for you.
and make frequent use of the car's horn when coming around the numerous blind corners in the mountains.

content=Grand Anse, St. Georges. Breakfast, lunch and dinner on a colorful deck suspended over the water. Mexican and Caribbean Cuisine.
content=St. George's. On a stretch of grey-black sand bay lined tall palms, this is a true Granadian experience.
content=St. George's, on the Lagoon Road across from Port Louis offers a wonderful tapas-like presentation of island cuisine.
at the Grand Anse has a local fruit, Soup joint, IGA Supermarket, Grill Master, Ritual's Coffee House, Fruit smoothie Shop and a Chinese take away and a KFC Outside.

content=St. George's, manufacturer of nutmeg products including liqueur, syrup, pepper sauce, jams and jellies.

content=Hermitage, St. Patrick's, produces organic dark chocolate with vintage machinery run by solar power. You should be able to find the colorfully packaged bars in stores throughout the island. Tours of the factory have been stopped but you can see the processing of Cocoa Pods in Chocolate beans at the Belmont Estate Plantation which is close by.
directions=in the north of the island
content=Lunch of salads, fish, chicken and steak or can try the more elegant fine dining dinner. Menu is of fresh local produce and changes on a daily basis.

, on Grand Anse Beach. A famous 'liming spot' on the island, known for its Amazing homemade burgers and fresh food, cold drinks and great prices. Upper and lower deck, so casual, you can walk up from the beach with your sandy feet. Be prepared to be there often!
, Morne Rouge Beach. 9:30PM - late. Gets going pretty good on the weekends with live shows. Small cover charge.
content=Waterfront dining, Caribbean and Mexican Cuisine, Daily  Sunset Happy Hour, Seasonal live music Tues, Fri, Sat. Wednesday Night Music Jam from 10PM.

Grenada offers a variety of accommodations, from small guesthouses to five star, all-inclusive resorts:

value: content=Located on the west coast of Grenada with a lovely sea view and breathtaking sunset.
content=A charmingly informal resort, offering luxurious rooms/suites in a garden setting that's home to many species of wild birds, and one of Grenada's finest restaurants, La Belle Creole.
content=Comprises two fabulous villas, the Tradewind Pavilion and the Turtle Back Pavilion, each with a swimming pool in Lance Aux Epines.
content=8 suite/apartments at the north end of Grand Anse Beach. Owned and operated by Jennifer Hosten (Miss World 1970) and her husband, Shaun.

content="Businessman's hotel" located in the Lagoon, overlooking the Marina and Yacht Club, just a short bus ride away from St.George's and the Grand Anse Beach. Twenty double rooms, all with private bath, air conditioning and cable television. Good restaurant and bar.
content=Grenada's First and Only Backpacker Hostel! Come stay at a friendly and fun backpacker hostel in St. George's. Easy transport to and from airport, Grand Anse Beach, waterfall and more.

content=Located in the heart of the parish of St. Andrews, Sam's Inn is tucked just far enough away from the busy resorts to give you a relaxing stay on the beautiful Island of Grenada, yet still close enough to satisfy all of your needs.
directions=Between Grand Anse and Morne rouge bay beaches
content=One of the highest full service resorts on the island with spectacular views over the world famous Grand Anse Beach and the secluded Morne Rouge Bay beach.
content=This Caribbean boutique hotel is set among tropical gardens sloping down to the sparkling blue waters of True Blue Bay.

content=Unique beachfront boutique hotel with fabulous views of the Grenadines, set in beautiful tropical gardens. Swimming pool, jacuzzi, bar and restaurant on the unspoilt north coast. Offers trips to beautiful Sandy Island.
Grenada has very low crime rates.
There is a main Hospital in St.George's, and a smaller hospital at Mirabeau on the east coast.
